3.71. 
Survival of the right to use the dwelling 
1. If the living space is the property of one spouse, the court may, by its decision, establish usufruct and allow the other spouse to reside in the living space, provided that minor children remain living with the other spouse after the dissolution of the marriage. 
2. The usufruct is established until the child(ren) reaches the age of majority. 3. If the family home has been rented, the court may transfer the rights of the tenant to the spouse with whom the minor children remain or who is incapacitated, and evict the other spouse if he/she is obliged to separate.
